Main.TextJPN: 私がやらなきゃいけない残りの作業は、すべての後始末だった。
Main.TextENG: It had been very hot for the past few days, and the corpses went rotten quickly. Any housewife knows how fast fresh meat can go bad. I know it, too. That's why the first thing I did was to dismember the corpses.

Main.TextJPN: こうなった以上は、覚悟もできてくる。だから、別にこんな作業はへっちゃらだった。
Main.TextENG: There was only one reason why I needed to dismember them. I had to reduce them to a portable size, in order to carry them to a place where they'll never be found. When men see the words ``dismembered corpses,`` they'll probably feel disgusted, because they don't cook. But housewives are used to taking the guts out of fish, and they sometimes even see living maggots. They take the maggots off of the food, or even cook it with the maggots still on. The heat will kill them, after all.

Main.TextJPN: それに、こいつらがいなくなったことで全ての悩みから解放されたのだ。
Main.TextENG: Women don't tell men what they do in the kitchen because men wouldn't eat the food if they knew. So it didn't really bother me much to dismember them. I was released from all my problems by killing them. Cleaning up the mess was like nothing to me, because I got freedom and regained my happiness.

Main.TextJPN: それと引き換えなら、これくらいのこと…………耐えてみせる。
Main.TextENG: I dismembered the corpses using carpenter's tools like a saw and a hatchet. I'm wearing a black sweat suit I bought for today because I thought I might get stained with blood. Bloodstains don't show on black fabric, and I can just throw it away after it's done. I brought a plastic sheet I found in the dump because I thought the blood might spread otherwise.

Main.TextJPN: ……振り返るな。@kいま立ち止まってしまったら、もうこの先一歩も進めなくなる。
Main.TextENG: If I did the work on this sheet, I could just burn it after I was done. ...In the end, dismembering human bodies is no different from preparing food on a chopping board.@k I was very tired from chopping apart two adult bodies, but I didn't have a problem doing it. I cut off their arms, legs, and heads, dividing each body into six pieces.

Main.TextJPN: どす黒い、まるで重油のようなものが全身にまとわりついて、動くことも、考えることすらできなくなる。
Main.TextENG: I heard before that blades get easily ruined by fat when you cut apart a corpse. So, I brought many kinds of tools. And I was right. I didn't have to go back and forth between here and my house to get another tool in the middle of work. A long time ago, the construction manager was murdered and his body was dismembered here during the dam conflict. He was cut into six pieces in the same way. Well, I had two bodies, so there was double that, though.

Main.TextJPN: 私が、今できること。@k……それは、どこまでも信じることだ。
Main.TextENG: I remembered the main suspect was still on the loose, and the victim's arm he hid hadn't been found yet. I wonder where he hid it.@k I'd like to ask him. I smiled wryly. Unlike the arms, legs, and heads, the torsos were difficult to take care of. I thought about cutting them into smaller pieces, but I decided against it because I thought it'd be troublesome to clean up the guts.

Main.TextJPN: このゴミ山で、やってしまった……いや、やり遂げたことが、自分にとって究極の選択だったことを――――。
Main.TextENG: I put each piece in a black trash bag and sprayed on a lot of deodorant. I wasn't sure if that would help against the smell, though. Many bugs flew around me while I was dismembering the corpses. After I finished putting all the pieces into each bag, the bugs were still flying around, but that was just because they could smell the blood. After I cleaned up everything, they were all gone. Now all I need to do is get rid of these twelve black bags.

Main.TextJPN: ……ああ、そう言えば昔、ダム戦争の末期にまさにこの地で、現場監督の殺人事件があったんだっけ。
Main.TextENG: Burning them would be easiest, but I don't think I can burn them to ashes without using a cremator. The best way is to bury them somewhere. Other than the torsos, every piece is small enough to fit in my backpack. I could easily carry them without being noticed.

Main.TextJPN: 最初、このダム現場を貫いて流れる沢に流してしまおうかと思った。
Main.TextENG: I could throw them into the river running through the dam construction site...

Main.TextJPN: でも、そんなことすれば絶対に下流で誰かが見つける。
Main.TextENG: but if I did that, somebody would find them for sure.

Main.TextJPN: たまにニュースで、流れ着いた先の川原で見つかった……なんて話を見た気がする。
Main.TextENG: I've seen on the news several times before that a bag with a body part in it was found beside a river... Every time I heard something like that, I always thought the murderer was stupid. I thought about dumping them into the Onigafuchi Swamp. But rotten meat floats. I thought about weighting the bags... but there's no guarantee they'd stay down. So, that left me one choice: to bury them.

Main.TextJPN: @bやごうち.@<谷河内@>か高津戸辺りの廃村地区をもっと奥に行けば、未開の山がいくつもある。
Main.TextENG: There are many unexplored mountains at the end of the abandoned districts around Yagouchi and Takatsudo.

Main.TextJPN: そんな山のどこかなら、大丈夫のはずだ。
Main.TextENG: It's probably best to bury them somewhere in the mountains.

Main.TextJPN: ……止まるな、足を踏み出せ。
Main.TextENG: While it would be safe to bury them here in the garbage dump, too, it's not perfectly safe.

Main.TextJPN: ……振り返るな、前だけを見つめろ。
Main.TextENG: And so, I'm going to bury all these bags somewhere deep inside of a mountain, in order to completely erase the two of them.

Main.TextJPN: ………使い慣れない筋肉を酷使したせいか、体の節々が痛む。
Main.TextENG: ...My joints hurt, since I've been using muscles I don't normally use.

Main.TextJPN: 私は丁寧に後片付けをすると、そのまま隠れ家に入り、マットレスの上に横になった。
Main.TextENG: I cleaned up the mess very carefully and got into my hideout. While still wearing the sweat suit, I laid down on the mattress.

Main.TextJPN: ……じっとりと浮かんだ額の汗が、前髪を張り付かせて気持ち悪い。
Main.TextENG: I washed my hands carefully, but there was still dirt and blood under my nails.

Main.TextJPN: 後でお風呂に入ろう。@k時間をかけて、……ゆっくり全身を洗い流そう。
Main.TextENG: ...I should take a shower later@k and wash it off completely.

Main.TextJPN: 今やっていることを省みれば、……何だか自分が、世紀の大悪人のように思えてくる。
Main.TextENG: When I say things like ``disposing of corpses,`` it sounds like I'm the greatest evil of the century.

Main.TextJPN: でも、……他に方法があったのか。
Main.TextENG: But that's only true if I get caught.

Main.TextJPN: 絶対なんて言葉は無いけど、…私だって、罪を犯したくてやったわけじゃない。
Main.TextENG: What I did isn't a crime as long as I don't get caught... Plus, I didn't do this because I wanted to commit a crime.

Main.TextJPN: 私は、悪いことはしていない。
Main.TextENG: I didn't do anything wrong.

Main.TextJPN: 自分とお父さんの生活を守るためにやったんだ。
Main.TextENG: I did this to protect my father's life and mine.

Main.TextJPN: それを罵る人間は所詮は対岸の人間。
Main.TextENG: People might speak ill of me, but I don't care about them.

Main.TextJPN: 結局、罪なんて、何者にも裁けないのかもしれない。@k罪は裁くものではなく、認めて贖罪するものだ。
Main.TextENG: In the end, I don't think anybody can really pass judgment on my sins.@k Sins aren't something to pass judgment on; they're something to confess and to atone for.

Main.TextJPN: つまり、罪は犯した本人にしか測れないということ。
Main.TextENG: In other words, nobody can measure the weight of a sin other than the person who committed the crime.

Main.TextJPN: 私に悔悟や後悔の念は？
Main.TextENG: Do I regret what I did? Do I feel sorry?

Main.TextJPN: …………ない。そんなもの、……無いに決まってる。
Main.TextENG: No.

Main.TextJPN: 今この瞬間も、私は間違ったことをしたなんて思っていない。
Main.TextENG: I don't think I did anything wrong.

Main.TextJPN: これ以上の最善策などなかったと断言できる。
Main.TextENG: I truly believe there was no better way than killing them.

Main.TextJPN: それに、……あの２人を殺したその夜から、私の生活は少しずつ変わり始めたからだ。
Main.TextENG: I'm sure it was the right thing, because... my life had already started to change since the night I killed them.

Main.TextJPN: 鉄平を殺してから帰宅した時。
Main.TextENG: A few days earlier. I just came home after killing Teppei.

Main.TextJPN: ……父は泣き腫らした顔で、荒れた室内を片付けていた。
Main.TextENG: ...My father was cleaning the room Teppei had thrashed earlier. His eyes were swollen. He'd been crying.

Main.TextJPN: 「………礼奈、……どこへ行ってたんだ…？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Reina... where have you been?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あの男と話をしてきた。@k@vS09/02/170200369.もうリナさんは二度とこの家に来ない。@k@vS09/02/170200370.だからあなたも来ないでって言った。@k@vS09/02/170200371.だからあいつはもう来ないよ」
Main.TextENG: ``I was talking with him.@k@vS09/02/170200369. I said, 'Rina-san will never come to our house again,@k@vS09/02/170200370. so please leave us alone.'@k@vS09/02/170200371. Therefore, he'll never come back.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そんなので大人しくしてくれるヤツじゃないぞきっと…。@k@vS09/00/172900028.礼奈もしばらくは用心した方がいい…」
Main.TextENG: ``I don't think he'll stay away from us that easily...@k@vS09/00/172900028. You should watch out for him for a while, too...``

Main.TextJPN: あの男が二度と訪れないことを父に説明するのは難しかった。
Main.TextENG: It's hard to explain to him why Teppei would never come back.

Main.TextJPN: …殺したから大丈夫などとは、当然言えるわけもない。
Main.TextENG: ...I can't tell him he shouldn't worry because I killed him.

Main.TextJPN: 私は冷蔵庫から氷を出し、ビニール袋に詰めてタオルに巻いて父に差し出す。
Main.TextENG: I grabbed ice cubes from the freezer, put them in a plastic bag, and handed it to my father.

Main.TextJPN: 「お父さん、はい。@k@vS09/02/170200371_2.…………ほっぺた、すごい腫れてるよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Here you go, Dad.@k@vS09/02/170200371_2. ...Your cheeks are swollen.``

Main.TextJPN: 父は自分で頬を触って初めて、腫れあがっていることに気付いたらしかった。
Main.TextENG: He must have only noticed it just then.

Main.TextJPN: 「……あぁ、…ありがとう」
Main.TextENG: ``......Oh... thank you.``

Main.TextJPN: 「私が片付けるからいいよ。@k@vS09/02/170200373.掃除機持ってくるね」
Main.TextENG: ``Don't worry about cleaning up the mess. I'll do it.@k@vS09/02/170200373. I'll get the vacuum cleaner.``

Main.TextJPN: 呼び止めるように父が呼ぶ。
Main.TextENG: He called out to me.

Main.TextJPN: 「………お父さんが悪かった。@k@vS09/00/172900034.………ごめんな、本当に」
「仕方ないよ。@k@vS09/02/170200375.…あいつらは騙すのが生業だもん。@k@vS09/02/170200376.…だからお父さんは騙されただけだよ」
Main.TextENG: ``It's not your fault.@k@vS09/02/170200375. ...They make their living by deceiving people.@k@vS09/02/170200376. ...You were just one of their targets.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……………礼奈は、…あいつらがそういう連中だって知ってたのか？」
Main.TextENG: ``......Reina... did you know who they were?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…うん。最近だけどね。@k@vS09/02/170200378.言っても信じてくれないと思って言わなかった。@k@vS09/02/170200379.ごめんね」
Main.TextENG: ``...Yes. I found out recently.@k@vS09/02/170200378. I didn't tell you because I thought you wouldn't believe me.@k@vS09/02/170200379. I'm sorry.``

Main.TextJPN: 父は少し俯く。
Main.TextENG: He looked down.

Main.TextJPN: 私は、リナが再婚の話をした時に、あの２人は結婚詐欺の悪人だと告げていた。
Main.TextENG: When he told me about how he wanted to get remarried, I told him that they were bad people and that they scammed others with badger games.

Main.TextJPN: でも父はそれを聞こうとはしなかった。
Main.TextENG: But he didn't listen to me.

Main.TextJPN: だから、言っても信じてくれないというのは正しかったことになる。
Main.TextENG: So, I was right in saying that he wouldn't have believed me at all.

Main.TextJPN: 「お父さんは、母さんとの離婚で落ち込んでいるところを付け入られたんだよ」
Main.TextENG: ``She took advantage of your pain.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…………………お父さんは、……本当に駄目なお父さんだよな」
Main.TextENG: ``............I'm... a very bad father.``

Main.TextJPN: それから父は、罪滅ぼしのようにリナとの馴れ初めを語り始めた。
Main.TextENG: Then he started talking about how he met Rina, as if trying to absolve his guilt.

Main.TextJPN: 酒の力を借りなければ苦い思い出に抗えなかった、一番辛かった時。
Main.TextENG: It was when he was suffering the most, and he needed to drink away his sorrow.

Main.TextJPN: たまたま入った店で接客してくれたのがリナだった。
Main.TextENG: At a bar he happened to go into, Rina-san was the one who came to his table.

Main.TextJPN: 元々、客の話を聞くのが商売だ。
Main.TextENG: It was her job to be a good listener when her customers talked.

Main.TextJPN: リナは親身に父の離婚話に耳を傾け、慰めの言葉をかけてくれただろう。
Main.TextENG: Rina must really have been a great listener, and offered words of comfort when he talked about the divorce.

Main.TextJPN: 普通の人間なら、それはその場限りの言葉として受け取れたろうが、@k……救いの欲しい父には、それが新しい出会いのように感じられたに違いない。
Main.TextENG: If he was emotionally stable, he could've taken it as a kindness that she was only offering at the time.@k ...But he was so desperate that he took it the wrong way.

Main.TextJPN: あとは、見るも無残な物語。
Main.TextENG: After that, the tragedy was inevitable.

Main.TextJPN: それを運命の出会いと信じたい父は、リナの全てを好意的に見て美化した。
Main.TextENG: He wanted to believe that it was destiny, and he glamorized everything about her.

Main.TextJPN: ……夢を見過ぎだと笑うのは簡単だ。@kでも、その弱さこそ人間であることの証なのだから、仕方がない。
Main.TextENG: ...It would be easy to laugh at him, and say that he was just dreaming.@k But I don't blame him, because being weak is also part of being human.

Main.TextJPN: 逸脱した金銭感覚に疑いを持つ機会があってもよかった。
Main.TextENG: He had plenty of opportunities to grow suspicious of her questionable spending habits.

Main.TextJPN: …でも父は、それすらも、彼女が自分を元気付けるために振舞っているのだと勝手に解釈した。
Main.TextENG: ...But my father just read even that behavior as an attempt to cheer him up.

Main.TextJPN: リナの望むままに何でも買い与え、自らリナの言いなりと成り果てていった。
Main.TextENG: He bought everything she asked him to, and Rina had landed her catch.

Main.TextJPN: 娘と住まう家に、独身の女性を連れ込むなんて普通じゃない。
Main.TextENG: He shouldn't have brought his lover to the house where his daughter lived.

Main.TextJPN: …でも、もう父はリナに夢中で、そんなことには気が回らなかった。
Main.TextENG: ...But he was crazy about her, and he didn't even think about it.

Main.TextJPN: 「……お父さんは、……お父さんであることを忘れちゃってたんだ。@k@vS09/00/172900038.………本当にどうかしてた………」
Main.TextENG: ``......I'd forgotten that I was a father first.@k@vS09/00/172900038. ......What was I thinking......?``

Main.TextJPN: そう言い、すすり泣く。
Main.TextENG: He started crying.

Main.TextJPN: 私は、そのあまりに弱々しい父の肩を、そっと抱いた。
Main.TextENG: I held his shoulders gently.

Main.TextJPN: 「いいよ。@k@vS09/02/170200382.…………お父さんがそれに気付いてくれたなら、お父さんはお父さんなんだよ。@k@vS09/02/170200383.………私には１人しかいない、最後の肉親なんだから」
Main.TextENG: ``It's okay.@k@vS09/02/170200382. ......You realized it in the end. You're my father no matter what.@k@vS09/02/170200383. .........You're the only family I have.``

Main.TextJPN: 父はもう嗚咽しか漏らせない。
Main.TextENG: He couldn't stop moaning.

Main.TextJPN: ……そして、私たちは静かに抱き合い、互いに涙を流し合った…。
Main.TextENG: ......We held each other and cried together...

Main.TextJPN: 翌日、父はとても早起きだった。
Main.TextENG: The next day, my father got up early in the morning.

Main.TextJPN: 私が起きた時には、台所に立って朝食を作ろうとしていたのだ。
Main.TextENG: He was already cooking breakfast when I got up.

Main.TextJPN: 驚く私に、父は言った。
Main.TextENG: And he told me...

Main.TextJPN: 「お父さんは、今日からしっかりするからな」
Main.TextENG: ``Your father is going to get his act together from today onward.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あ、あはははははははは。@k@vS09/02/170200385.でも、お父さん、目玉焼きを焼く前にサラダオイルは敷いた方がいいと思うかな」
Main.TextENG: ``Ah... Ahahahahahahahaha.@k@vS09/02/170200385. Dad, you should've used salad oil before you cooked them sunny-side up.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あ！@k@vS09/00/172900041.　………あはははは、久しぶりの台所なんで、…あははははは」
Main.TextENG: ``Hh!@k@vS09/00/172900041. ...Ahahahaha, it's been a long time since I cooked. ...Ahahahahaha.``

Main.TextJPN: 父は焦げ付きかけていた目玉焼きをフライ返しで引っ掻いて剥がすと、今さらのようにサラダオイルを加えた。
Main.TextENG: He pried off the burning eggs on the pan with a spatula, and he added salad oil to it.

Main.TextJPN: そんなことしてももう遅い。@kフライパンを汚してしまっただけだ。
Main.TextENG: It was too late.@k Doing that just made it an even bigger mess.

Main.TextJPN: でも、お父さんの目玉焼きが食べたいから私はそれ以上の文句は言わずに、黙って食卓で待った。
Main.TextENG: But I didn't say anything, because I wanted to eat his eggs. I waited at the table quietly.

Main.TextJPN: 父が持ってきたお皿には汚れきった目玉焼き風の物体があるだけ。
Main.TextENG: He put the burned eggs on a plate, and brought them over to me.

Main.TextJPN: チーズ片を混ぜてみようという遊び心の痕跡もあったが、すっかり焦げてしまって大失敗だ。
Main.TextENG: It looked like he tried to salvage them by adding cheese, but it didn't really work.

Main.TextJPN: でも匂いはとても香ばしくて食欲を誘った。
Main.TextENG: Still, it smelled good and crispy. It actually stimulated my appetite.

Main.TextJPN: ポンとトースターが上がり、厚切りのトーストが出来上がる。
Main.TextENG: Thick-cut toast popped out of the toaster.

Main.TextJPN: 父は甘いのが好きだから、牛乳たっぷりに砂糖を加えたカフェオレを作った。
Main.TextENG: I made coffee with extra milk and sugar because my father liked it sweet.

Main.TextJPN: それらを並べて見ると、まるで小学生の家庭科の授業のような無残な出来ではあったけど、……エプロン姿の父の一生懸命さでとても輝いて見えた。
Main.TextENG: We put everything on the table. It looked terrible, like the cooking class of an elementary school... But to me, it was precious, because my father tried very hard to make it, wearing the apron.

Main.TextJPN: 「うん。@k@vS09/02/170200387.匂いだけならおいしそうだよ。@k@vS09/02/170200388.あとは味だね、あははは」
Main.TextENG: ``Great.@k@vS09/02/170200387. It smells good.@k@vS09/02/170200388. I hope it tastes as good as it smells. Ahahaha.``

Main.TextJPN: 「やっぱり食事は礼奈がやった方がいいかもなぁ…。@k@vS09/00/172900043.これじゃかえって悪い気がする…」
Main.TextENG: ``It might be better that you do the cooking...@k@vS09/00/172900043. I feel bad making you eat this...``

Main.TextJPN: 「お父さんが仕事で忙しくなったら、また私が代わるよ」
Main.TextENG: ``I'll take care of cooking when you take care of getting a job.``

Main.TextJPN: それまで、私と父の間で仕事の話はタブーだった。
Main.TextENG: It had been a taboo to talk about work in our house.

Main.TextJPN: 父は離婚以来、仕事に就いていなかったからだ。
Main.TextENG: He hadn't worked since the divorce.

Main.TextJPN: 離婚のせいだけでもない。
Main.TextENG: It wasn't only because of the divorce, though.

Main.TextJPN: 母が残した慰謝料が莫大だったせいもある。
Main.TextENG: He just didn't have to work because the settlement my mother gave him was so huge.

Main.TextJPN: そして離婚に対する私の負い目が父の怠惰を許してしまった。
Main.TextENG: Plus, I let him be lazy because I felt guilty about the divorce.

Main.TextJPN: でも、…………父の罪は、昨夜の後悔で晴らされた。
Main.TextENG: But...... my father cleared his wrongdoing by showing repentance to me.

Main.TextJPN: …そして、母の時に何もできなかった私の罪も、…昨日の出来事で、……自ら罪を滅ぼした。
Main.TextENG: ...And I also atoned for my sin of not doing anything about my mother... by doing what I did the previous night.

Main.TextJPN: もう、私たち親子には、何の罪もないのだ。
Main.TextENG: Now, we are free of sin.

Main.TextJPN: 「お父さん、……仕事を探してみるよ。@k@vS09/00/172900046.今日は職安に行ってこようと思う」
Main.TextENG: ``I... I'm going to try to find a job.@k@vS09/00/172900046. I'm thinking about going to the employment service agency today.``
``Yeah.@k@vS09/02/170200391. That's a great idea.``

Main.TextJPN: 生活費が欲しいんじゃない。@k父には、普通の生活習慣が必要だった。
Main.TextENG: It's not money that he wanted.@k He just needed a normal lifestyle.

Main.TextJPN: 「…こんな年で体力もないからなぁ…。いい仕事があるか不安だよ…」
Main.TextENG: ``...I'm old and not very strong... I'm a bit worried if I can find a job at all...``

Main.TextJPN: 「どんな仕事ならいいの？」
Main.TextENG: ``What kind of job are you looking for?``

Main.TextJPN: 「事務の仕事がいいけど、この年じゃなかなか雇ってもらえないだろうな」
Main.TextENG: ``I'd prefer a desk job, but I don't think a lot of companies would offer one to an old man like me.``

Main.TextJPN: 「私の友達に聞いてみるよ。@k@vS09/02/170200394.魅ぃちゃんはこの辺りの大地主のお嬢さんだから、ひょっとすると紹介してくれるかもしれないよ」
Main.TextENG: ``I can ask my friend.@k@vS09/02/170200394. Mii-chan is the daughter of a big landowner in Hinamizawa, so she might be able to find you something.``

Main.TextJPN: 「いいよいいよ、仕事くらい自分で探すよ。@k@vS09/00/172900050.その程度にはしっかりしないとな」
Main.TextENG: ``No, it's okay. I'll do it myself.@k@vS09/00/172900050. I have to man up, you know?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あはははははは」
Main.TextENG: ``Ahahahahahaha.``

Main.TextJPN: 父とこんなにも会話を弾ませた朝食はいつ以来だろう。
Main.TextENG: I don't remember the last time we enjoyed breakfast like this.

Main.TextJPN: ……いや、父と共にした朝食だってどれくらいに久しぶりなことか。
Main.TextENG: ...I don't even remember the last time we had breakfast together.

Main.TextJPN: 窓から入る朝の光が、こんなにも清々しかったことをようやく思い出す。
Main.TextENG: For the first time in a long time, the morning light felt refreshing.

Main.TextJPN: …こんな時間をいつまでも過ごしたいと思った。@kでも、残念なことに今日も学校がある。
Main.TextENG: ...I wanted to keep enjoying life like this.@k But unfortunately, I had to go to school.

Main.TextJPN: サボるからどこかに遊びに連れて行ってよと甘えたが、父はここぞとばかりに父親ぶり、登校しないとダメだぞ、なんて言った。
Main.TextENG: I told him that I'd skip school that day and that I wanted him to take me somewhere fun, but he tried to be a good father, and said that I had to go to school.

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃ、……私、学校行くね」
Main.TextENG: ``Well... I have to go now.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あぁ。行ってらっしゃい」
Main.TextENG: ``Okay... Have a good day at school.``

Main.TextJPN: 私が玄関に向かうと、見送りにわざわざ付いてきた。@k何だか恥ずかしい。
Main.TextENG: He followed me to the front door.@k I was a bit embarrassed for some reason.

Main.TextJPN: 靴紐を結んでいると、父が話しかけてきた。
Main.TextENG: He talked to me while I was tying my shoes.

Main.TextJPN: …見送りに来たのではなく、その言葉が伝えたかったからに違いない。
Main.TextENG: ...He followed me here not because he wanted to see me off, but because he wanted to tell me something.

Main.TextJPN: 「………お父さんは母さんとの離婚の後、ずっと寂しかった。@k@vS09/00/172900054.でも、お父さんは礼奈と一緒だから寂しくなんかないんだ。@k@vS09/00/172900055.そうだ、最初から寂しがることなんか何もなかったんだ」
Main.TextENG: ``......I've been sad ever since your mother divorced me.@k@vS09/00/172900054. But I realized that I shouldn't be sad, because I have you, Reina.@k@vS09/00/172900055. I didn't have to feel sad at all.``

Main.TextJPN: 「お父さん、………それを、家族って言うんじゃないかな」
Main.TextENG: ``Dad...... that's what being a family is about.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………そうだな。@k@vS09/00/172900057.…そんなことを、娘に教わるようじゃ、だめだな」
Main.TextENG: ``......Yes, you're right.@k@vS09/00/172900057. ...Again, I'm not a good father, because I had to learn something that simple and important from my own daughter.``

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃ、圭一くんを待たせてるからもう行くね」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, I have to go now. Keiichi-kun is waiting for me.``

Main.TextJPN: 「行ってらっしゃい。@k@vS09/00/172900059.あぁそうだ礼奈。@k@vS09/00/172900060.今日はお父さんが夕食を作るぞ。@k@vS09/00/172900061.職安に行くついでに買い物をしてくる。@k@vS09/00/172900062.朝食みたいな失敗はしないから楽しみにしてるんだぞ」
Main.TextENG: ``Have a good day.@k@vS09/00/172900059. Oh, Reina.@k@vS09/00/172900060. I'm going to cook dinner tonight.@k@vS09/00/172900061. I'll do the grocery shopping on the way back from the employment service agency.@k@vS09/00/172900062. Look forward to it. I promise I won't fail like I did just now.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あははははは、うん！@k@vS09/02/170200399.　楽しみにしてるよ。@k@vS09/02/170200400.行って来まーーす」
Main.TextENG: ``Ahahahahaha, okay!@k@vS09/02/170200399. I'm looking forward to it.@k@vS09/02/170200400. See you tonight!``

Main.TextJPN: エプロン姿の父に見送られての登校が、……新しい生活の第一歩。
Main.TextENG: I left the house. My father saw me off, still in the apron. ...It was the first step of our new life.

Main.TextJPN: 私は、やっと取り戻した。
Main.TextENG: I finally regained it.

Main.TextJPN: 雛見沢を出てから、おかしくなってしまった日々を、ようやく全て取り戻した。
Main.TextENG: I finally regained everything we lost after we left Hinamizawa.

Main.TextJPN: 確かにここには母がいないけれど、……私とお父さんは家族だから、何も寂しがることなんてない。
Main.TextENG: My mother wasn't around... but I didn't feel sad because I had my father.

Main.TextJPN: セミの賑やかな合唱は、まるで私の新生活を祝ってくれているようだった。
Main.TextENG: The cries of the cicadas sounded as if they were celebrating my new life.

Main.TextJPN: 日差しも明るく、風も爽やか。
Main.TextENG: The sunshine was bright, and the wind was sending up a nice breeze.

Main.TextJPN: 爽やかじゃないのは、…時計の針くらいかな？
Main.TextENG: The only thing that wasn't nice was... the ticking clock?

Main.TextJPN: 父とだいぶ話し込んでしまったから、結構遅れてしまった。
Main.TextENG: I was late because I spent too much time talking with my father.

Main.TextJPN: 圭一くんは待ちきれず、先に行ってしまってるかもしれない。
Main.TextENG: Keiichi-kun might already be gone. I don't think he'd be waiting for me that long.

Main.TextJPN: ……でも、居た。
Main.TextENG: ...But... he was there anyway.
``Hey!@k@vS09/01/170100257. Good morning!``

Main.TextJPN: 「あははは、おはよ～！@k@vS09/02/170200402.　遅れてごめんね、ごめんね」
Main.TextENG: ``Ahahaha, good morning~!@k@vS09/02/170200402. Sorry I'm late.``

Main.TextJPN: 「いいってことよ。@k@vS09/01/170100259.普段は俺がレナを待たせてるんだからな。@k@vS09/01/170100260.たまには俺を待たさせろ。@k@vS09/01/170100261.わっはっはっは！」
Main.TextENG: ``It's okay.@k@vS09/01/170100259. I usually make you wait.@k@vS09/01/170100260. So, it's okay that I wait once in a while.@k@vS09/01/170100261. Wa ha ha ha ha!``

Main.TextJPN: 「ずいぶん遅くなっちゃったね。@k@vS09/02/170200404.早足で行った方がいいかな、…かな」
Main.TextENG: ``We're really going to be late.@k@vS09/02/170200404. We should walk fast, I think... I think.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうだな。@k@vS09/01/170100263.ちゃきちゃき行こうぜ。@k@vS09/01/170100264.さもないと走るはめになりそうだ」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS09/01/170100263. Let's walk fast.@k@vS09/01/170100264. We might have to run at the end.``

Main.TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん、さすがに先に行っちゃってるかな」
Main.TextENG: ``Mii-chan might already be gone.``

Main.TextJPN: 「待ってるだろ、絶対。@k@vS09/01/170100264_2.俺たちは仲間だぜ？@k@vS09/01/170100264_3.　絶対に見捨てないし、勝手に行っちゃったりはしないよ」
Main.TextENG: ``She's waiting for sure.@k@vS09/01/170100264_2. We're friends.@k@vS09/01/170100264_3. We'd never leave each other behind, right?``

Main.TextJPN: 「それはそうと、今日は朝からいいことでもあったのかー？」
Main.TextENG: ``Anyway, did something good happen this morning?``
``What?@k@vS09/02/170200408. Why do you ask that?``

Main.TextJPN: 「いやさ、今朝のレナは普段にも増して上機嫌そうだったからさ。@k@vS09/01/170100267.特別なことでもあったのかなって」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, you look very happy for some reason.@k@vS09/01/170100267. I just thought maybe something good happened to you.``

Main.TextJPN: 私の上機嫌は、圭一くんに一目で看破されるほど露出しているようだった。
Main.TextENG: The good mood I was in must have been too obvious for Keiichi-kun to ignore.

Main.TextJPN: 私には家族がいて、そして仲間がいる。
Main.TextENG: I had not only my family, but my friends too.

Main.TextJPN: 胸いっぱいに、温かいものが広がっていくのを感じた。
Main.TextENG: I felt something warm spreading in my heart.

Main.TextJPN: 「……あははははは。@k@vS09/02/170200410.それがね、聞いて聞いて。@k@vS09/02/170200411.朝食をお父さんが作ってくれたんだけどね、…それがね、あははははは…」
Main.TextENG: ``...Ahahahahaha.@k@vS09/02/170200410. Well, I'll tell you what happened this morning.@k@vS09/02/170200411. My father made breakfast, but... ahahahahaha...``

Main.TextJPN: 「何だよ、目玉焼きはそれで正しいだろ？@k@vS09/01/170100269.　サラダオイルってのはサラダに使うもんなんだろ…？」
Main.TextENG: ``What? Isn't that the right way to cook eggs?@k@vS09/01/170100269. You use salad oil for making salads, don't you?``

Main.TextJPN: 「えーーー？！@k@vS09/02/170200413.　あっはっはっは。@k@vS09/02/170200414.魅ぃちゃんたちに教えてあげよーっとーー」
Main.TextENG: ``What?!@k@vS09/02/170200413. Ah ha ha ha.@k@vS09/02/170200414. I have to tell everyone you just said that!``

Main.TextJPN: 「なぁんですってーー！」
Main.TextENG: ``What did you say?!

Main.TextJPN: 「それは許しがたい暴言でございましてよーーッ！！」
Main.TextENG: Those rude remarks are unforgivable!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「おぅ上等だぜ、そこまで言うからには直接対決も辞さない覚悟だろうなぁ！」
Main.TextENG: ``Fine, bring it. If you're saying that, then you're willing and ready to throw down, aren't you?!

Main.TextJPN: 「おーおー、盛り上がってるじゃなーい。@k@vS09/03/170300144.何なら今日の部活さ、沙都子と圭ちゃんで外ウマ行こうか～？」
Main.TextENG: ``Hey hey, what's going on?@k@vS09/03/170300144. Satoko, Kei-chan, why don't you two place an outside bet on our club activities today? It'll be fun.``

Main.TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん、外ウマって何かな、かな」
Main.TextENG: ``Mii-chan, what's an outside bet? What is it?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あー、外ウマってのはよ。@k@vS09/01/170100272.つまり、俺と沙都子だけで賭けをするってことさ。@k@vS09/01/170100273.部活の順位がそのまま勝敗になって、負けた方は俺たちだけのペナルティを課す！」
Main.TextENG: ``An outside bet means what it says,@k@vS09/01/170100272. that Satoko and I would place a bet on each other outside the game.@k@vS09/01/170100273. The one who played worse than the other has to suffer an extra punishment besides the normal one!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……つまり、どっちが勝っても負けても、ボクはとっても楽しいのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......That means I get to see one of you suffer no matter who loses today.``
``Heh heh heh!@k@vS09/03/170300146. So, what do you say, Satoko?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あらあら素敵な勝負でございますことよー！@k@vS09/04/170400041.　部活にビリで罰ゲームな上に、さらに私に負けてダブルで罰ゲームなんて、こんな素敵なことがございましてー？！」
Main.TextENG: ``That sounds like a wonderful idea to me!@k@vS09/04/170400041. Keiichi-san will take a punishment for being the lowest-ranked in the game and another punishment for losing to me! Ah, how wonderful!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「よーーし、沙都子、よく受けたね！」
Main.TextENG: ``Great! I like your spirit, Satoko!

Main.TextJPN: 「よっしゃ、今日の部活は２人の外ウマ付きでやろう！」
Main.TextENG: Alright, let's play today's game with their outside bet!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……部活の種目より、罰ゲームを何にするか考える方が楽しいのですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``......It's more fun to think about punishments than to think about the game itself.``

Main.TextJPN: 「確かに楽しいよなぁー！@k@vS09/01/170100275.　沙都子がどんな悲惨な目に遭うか、今から想像できちまうぜーー！」
Main.TextENG: ``It sure is!@k@vS09/01/170100275. I can't wait to see how miserable Satoko's going to look after she takes her punishment!``

Main.TextJPN: 「それは圭一さんのことでございましてよーー！！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Keep dreaming, Keiichi-san!!!

Main.TextJPN: 「むがぁ！　ぶにぃ！　やりましたわねぇ！！　むにゅぅ！」
Main.TextENG: Ouch! Take that! Stop it!! Hyaah!``

Main.TextJPN: 「ほらほら、二人とも勝負はまだ始まってないってー！」
Main.TextENG: ``Stop fighting, you two! The game hasn't even started yet!``

Main.TextJPN: ガラガラっと扉が開き、知恵先生が現れる。
Main.TextENG: Chie-sensei opened the door and came in.

Main.TextJPN: 「皆さん、お待たせしました。@k@vS09/22/171400003.それでは帰りのＨＲを始めますよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Take your seats, everyone.@k@vS09/22/171400003. Let's start homeroom, and then you can all go home.``

Main.TextJPN: 好き放題に散っていたクラスメイトたちがそれぞれの席へ戻った。
Main.TextENG: Everybody headed to their seats.

Main.TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん」
Main.TextENG: ``Mii-chan.``
``Hm? What?``

Main.TextJPN: 「圭一くんと沙都子ちゃんがとても盛り上がっているところで申し訳ないんだけど…。@k@vS09/02/170200418.……ごめんね、ちょっと今日も用事があって、すぐ帰らないといけないの…」
Main.TextENG: ``I'm sorry to ruin the mood, but...@k@vS09/02/170200418. I have to go home after school. I have things to do again today...``

Main.TextJPN: 「え、…そーなのー？@k@vS09/03/170300152.　まぁ、用事じゃあ仕方ないなぁ。@k@vS09/03/170300153.お家の仕事？」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh... Okay.@k@vS09/03/170300152. Well, I'm sorry that you have to go.@k@vS09/03/170300153. Are you busy with housework or something?``

Main.TextJPN: 「うん」
「家事ってんじゃ、おじさんは口出しできないなぁ。@k@vS09/03/170300155.……うちはお手伝いさんに全部任せっきりだからね」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, this ol' man has no right to stop you when it comes to housework.@k@vS09/03/170300155. I don't do housework myself. Our housekeepers do.``

Main.TextJPN: 「たまには魅ぃちゃんも家事手伝いとかすればいいのに。@k@vS09/02/170200421.きっと花嫁修業になるよー」
Main.TextENG: ``You should help them sometimes.@k@vS09/02/170200421. It'll be good training for married life.``

Main.TextJPN: 「ご安心を。@k@vS09/03/170300157.万事、その手のスキルに関してはつつがなく習得済みですので。@k@|@y@vS09/03/170300158.あっひゃっひゃっひゃ」
Main.TextENG: ``Don't worry about that.@k@vS09/03/170300157. I already have the kind of skill, you know, to be a good wife.@k@|@y@vS09/03/170300158. Heh heh heh heh.``

Main.TextJPN: 面倒臭がり屋に見えて、実は何でもできてしまうのが魅ぃちゃんのすごいところだ。
Main.TextENG: Mii-chan looks like the kind of girl who tries to stay away from chores as much as possible, but she can actually do everything. That's just who she is.

Main.TextJPN: それらは、みんな苦労して学んだことなのに、@kさも努力せずに出来たかのように振舞うところが、何だか魅ぃちゃんらしいというか何というか。@k微笑ましいところだ。
Main.TextENG: She went through hard times to learn those things,@k but she acts like she learned them without any struggle. That's also who she is.@k I like that about her.

Main.TextJPN: 「えーーー、何だよレナ。@k@vS09/01/170100277.帰っちゃうのかよ」
Main.TextENG: ``What?@k@vS09/01/170100277. Are you going home, Rena?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あら、圭一さんが恥ずかしい格好で職員室にお伺いしなくちゃならないところをご覧になりませんのー？」
Main.TextENG: ``Then you won't see Keiichi-san go to the teacher's office wearing an embarrassing uniform. What a shame.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……見物なのに、残念なのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......It's going to be fun. Pity you have to miss it.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…うん、ごめんね」
Main.TextENG: ``...Yeah, I'm sorry.``

Main.TextJPN: 「昨日も家の用事だったじゃねーかよ」
Main.TextENG: ``You went home right after school for housework yesterday, too.

Main.TextJPN: 「何かあったのか？」
Main.TextENG: Did something happen?``

Main.TextJPN: 「うん。ちょっとね、色々。@k@vS09/02/170200423.もう何日か掛かるかもしれない」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah, kind of.@k@vS09/02/170200423. It might take me a few more days.``

Main.TextJPN: 「ふーん。@k@vS09/01/170100281.じゃ当分、レナは部活に参加できないかな」
Main.TextENG: ``Well.@k@vS09/01/170100281. Then I guess you can't join us for a while.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…かもしれない。@k@vS09/02/170200425.なるべく早く復帰できるようにがんばる」
Main.TextENG: ``...Maybe.@k@vS09/02/170200425. I'll try to finish as soon as I can.``

Main.TextJPN: 「その用事は俺たちには手伝えることか？@k@vS09/01/170100283.　たとえば、古い家具を運び出すとか、そういう力仕事なら言ってくれ。@k@vS09/01/170100284.応援に行くぜー！」
Main.TextENG: ``Can we help out with the thing you have to do?@k@vS09/01/170100283. If it's something like carrying out old furniture, let me know.@k@vS09/01/170100284. I can help with that!``

Main.TextJPN: 「家の模様替えとかかい？@k@vS09/03/170300160.　おじさんたちみんなで手伝うよ？」
Main.TextENG: ``Are you redecorating your house?@k@vS09/03/170300160. This ol' man can bring lots of help for that.``

Main.TextJPN: 「をっほっほ！@k@vS09/04/170400046.　レナさんの家のお手伝いで優劣を競うのもありですわよねぇ！」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh ho ho!@k@vS09/04/170400046. I have an idea! We can make a game out of helping her out with her housework!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……多分、お手伝いしない方が優勝なのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......At this rate, the person who doesn't end up helping her will be the winner.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あははは、みんなありがと。@k@vS09/02/170200427.気持ちだけもらっておくね」
Main.TextENG: ``Ahahaha, thank you guys.@k@vS09/02/170200427. I really do appreciate it.``

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃあ仕方ない！@k@vS09/03/170300162.　竜宮レナを本日付で我が部より戦線離脱とする！@k@vS09/03/170300163.　お家の仕事が片付くまで休暇とするので、鋭気回復の上、再び戦線へ復帰することをここに命ずる！」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, it seems like there's nothing we can do.@k@vS09/03/170300162. Therefore, I announce Rena Ryuugu's withdrawal from the front lines as of today!@k@vS09/03/170300163. I order you to take a rest 'til you finish doing your housework, and to return to the front as soon as you've regained your strength!

Main.TextJPN: 「まー、４人なら４人で遊べるゲームもあるしねー！@k@vS09/03/170300165.　そだそだ、圭ちゃんは麻雀とかできるー？！」
Main.TextENG: Well, there are many games for four!@k@vS09/03/170300165. Oh, can you play mahjong, Kei-chan?``

Main.TextJPN: 「おう任せろ！@k@vS09/01/170100286.　親父の仕事関係の人たちの卓に無理やり混ぜられることもある！」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah!@k@vS09/01/170100286. My dad sometimes forces me to play mahjong with him and his friends from work!``

Main.TextJPN: 「をーっほっほっほ！@k@vS09/04/170400048.　もちろん、私たちは麻雀だって精通していましてよー！」
Main.TextENG: ``Hoh ho ho ho!@k@vS09/04/170400048. Of course, we are good at mahjong as well!``

Main.TextJPN: あとは部活メンバーのいつもの盛り上がりだった。
Main.TextENG: After that, they fooled around and made a lot of noise, just like they always did.

Main.TextJPN: 私はその微笑ましい仲間たちの中に、自分の居場所がこれからも在り続けることを改めて胸に刻んでから、教室を後にした。
Main.TextENG: I looked at them, and reminded myself that I'd always have a place to return to. I left the classroom with a smile.

Main.TextJPN: 家に帰ったら、自転車で@bやごうち.@<谷河内@>の方へ行ってみよう。
Main.TextENG: I was going to Yagouchi on my bicycle.

Main.TextJPN: …残りの作業を急がないと。
Main.TextENG: ...I had to find a place to bury the bags with the body parts.

Main.TextJPN: できれば、今日の日が暮れる前に、全てを終わらせたい。
Main.TextENG: Hopefully. I could finish burying all of them today before it gets dark.

Main.TextJPN: それで、きっと元通りだ。
Main.TextENG: With that, everything would be over and done with.

Main.TextJPN: 「牌の背中が竹だってのが何だか怖いよなぁ。@k@vS09/01/170100288.まさかガン牌ってことはないだろうなぁ？」
Main.TextENG: ``I don't like that the back of the tiles are made of bamboo.@k@vS09/01/170100288. You guys haven't marked them, have you?``

Main.TextJPN: 「さぁてどうでございましょうねぇ？@k@vS09/04/170400050.　圭一さんには、以前のジジ抜きの時に手痛い思い出がございますものねぇ？」
Main.TextENG: ``I wouldn't be too sure!@k@vS09/04/170400050. Keiichi-san, you sound traumatized by the experience you had with our card game.``

Main.TextJPN: 「まー、多少は傷もあるだろうねぇ。@k@vS09/03/170300167.安物の牌だしさ」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, I think there are some scratches on them.@k@vS09/03/170300167. They're cheap ones, you know.

Main.TextJPN: 「そのくらいの要素がないと、我が部らしくないでしょ？@k@vS09/03/170300169.　くっくっく！」
Main.TextENG: But it's more fun when there's an element of doubt, don't you think?@k@vS09/03/170300169. Heh heh heh!``
``......Mii, how many reds do you want to use?@k@vS09/05/170500039. Six?``

Main.TextJPN: …手馴れた梨花ちゃんが異様に末恐ろしく見えるのはなぜだろうな。
Main.TextENG: ...Rika-chan sounded professional, and it scared me.

Main.TextJPN: まぁいいや。@kそれより牌の確認から始めよう。
Main.TextENG: Oh well.@k I should start by checking the tiles.

Main.TextJPN: ……家族麻雀ならともかく、部活である以上、ゲーム前から用心してないとな！
Main.TextENG: ...Playing mahjong with my family is different from playing it as a club activity. I have to be cautious!

Main.TextJPN: じゃないと、実は何かが１牌足りなくて、特定の牌だけ５つあったなんてとんでもない事実を見逃す可能性だってある。
Main.TextENG: It's possible that one tile is missing or that there's one extra of a particular tile in here.

Main.TextJPN: 「そーんなことしないってぇ！」
Main.TextENG: ``We don't do things like that!

Main.TextJPN: 「…でも着想は面白いねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ...Still, that's interesting.

Main.TextJPN: 「そういう手もあるかぁ。@k@vS09/03/170300173.なるほどなるほど…」
Main.TextENG: I didn't think about that.@k@vS09/03/170300173. Let's see...``

Main.TextJPN: 「よしよし、牌をみんな表にして並べてみよう。@k@vS09/01/170100290.ほれほれほれ」
Main.TextENG: ``Let's put them all face-up on the table and check them before we start the game.@k@vS09/01/170100290. Come on.``

Main.TextJPN: みんなで牌を表向きにし、７並べのように整頓していく。
Main.TextENG: Everybody flipped the tiles face-up.

Main.TextJPN: 「あれ。@k@vS09/01/170100292.おい、誰かのとこに『中』が一個隠れてないかー？」
Main.TextENG: ``Hm?@k@vS09/01/170100292. One dragon is missing.``

Main.TextJPN: 「ピンズとソーズの六が１個ずつ足りないですわね」
Main.TextENG: ``One Lo-pin and one Lo-so are missing, too.

Main.TextJPN: 「……あら、マンズの六も１個足りませんでしてよ？」
Main.TextENG: ...Oh, one Lo-wan is missing also.``

Main.TextJPN: 「なんだなんだ！@k@vS09/01/170100294.　ずいぶんと足りないじゃないか」
Main.TextENG: ``What's going on?@k@vS09/01/170100294. There are so many missing tiles.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……あーーーーー！　そうだったそうだった。ちょいと待って」
Main.TextENG: ``...Oh! I remember. Hold on a second.``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音はポンと手を打つと席を立ち、自分の椅子を退かすと、床板の節目に指を突っ込む。
Main.TextENG: Mion hit the palm of her hand with her fist, moved her chair aside, and stuck her finger into a gap in the floorboards.

Main.TextJPN: 何事かと見守っていると、魅音の指先が牌を１つ摘み上げた。
Main.TextENG: She then pulled a tile out of there.

Main.TextJPN: 「はいよ、まずは『中』ねー」
Main.TextENG: ``There you go. This is the dragon.

Main.TextJPN: 「あとの３つはどこだったっけなーー」
Main.TextENG: I don't remember where I put the other three.``

Main.TextJPN: 「おい待て魅音。@k@vS09/01/170100296.どうして麻雀の牌が教室のあちこちに隠してあるんだよ…」
Main.TextENG: ``Wait, Mion.@k@vS09/01/170100296. Why are there so many tiles hidden in the classroom...?``

Main.TextJPN: 「にゃっはっはっは…。@k@vS09/03/170300178.まぁまぁ、あひゃひゃひゃひゃ…！」
Main.TextENG: ``Nya ha ha ha ha...@k@vS09/03/170300178. Well, you know, heh heh heh heh...!``

Main.TextJPN: 結局、３つの牌は教室のどこかに魅音が隠したまま忘れてしまったらしい。
Main.TextENG: She must have hidden the other three tiles somewhere in the classroom and forgot where.

Main.TextJPN: ３つも足らなかったらとてもゲームにならない。
Main.TextENG: We couldn't play mahjong with three tiles missing!

Main.TextJPN: 他のゲームに変えようと提案したが、魅音は、大事な部活の備品が欠けているのは気になると言い張り、３つの牌の宝探しで優劣を競おうなどと言い出した。
Main.TextENG: I suggested playing another game, but Mion insisted that we had to find them and suggested making that ``treasure hunt`` our game.

Main.TextJPN: 「まぁ確かに圭一さんと勝負をつけるなら、種目は何でもいいわけでございますけど…。@k@vS09/04/170400054.…もうちょっとまともな種目がいいですわねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``As long as I can make Keiichi-san suffer a punishment, I care little as to what kind of game we play, but...@k@vS09/04/170400054. To be honest with you, I'd prefer to play something more interesting than that.``

Main.TextJPN: 「同感だなぁ。@k@vS09/01/170100298.それにこの教室に本当にあるかも怪しいんだろ？」
Main.TextENG: ``I agree.@k@vS09/01/170100298. Plus, you're not sure they are here in the classroom, right, Mion?``

Main.TextJPN: 「多分あると思うんだよ」
Main.TextENG: ``No, they're here.

Main.TextJPN: 「……あるいはおじさんが懐に仕舞ったまま帰っちゃって、洗濯機の脇に置いてあるとか………、…かなぁ？」
Main.TextENG: ...Or maybe this ol' man might've put them in his pockets and left them by the washing machine. I don't remember.``

Main.TextJPN: ……今度から魅音と麻雀をやる時は、終わった後にも牌の数を調べた方がいいな。
Main.TextENG: ......I recommend checking the total number of tiles after we play mahjong with Mion next time.

Main.TextJPN: 俺の呟きに、魅音以外の全員が深く頷いた。
Main.TextENG: Everybody except Mion nodded in agreement.

Main.TextJPN: 「何よー。@k@vS09/03/170300183.教室宝探し対決じゃ不満ー？」
Main.TextENG: ``What?@k@vS09/03/170300183. You don't want to play our classroom tile-hunting game?``

Main.TextJPN: 「つーか、魅音のイカサマの後始末だろ。@k@vS09/01/170100300.お前の責任でやれ。@k@vS09/01/170100301.部活を私的に使うな」
Main.TextENG: ``In other words, 'cleaning up the mess Mion made so she could cheat'!@k@vS09/01/170100300. Do it yourself.@k@vS09/01/170100301. Don't use our club activities for personal reasons.``
``Fine, fine.@k@vS09/03/170300185. So, what do you want to do?
We can't play mahjong now.@k@vS09/03/170300187. What are we playing, then?@k@vS09/03/170300188. Does anybody have any ideas?``

Main.TextJPN: 部活の種目はほとんどの場合、魅音が部長権限で決めている。
Main.TextENG: As our club president, Mion usually decides what we'll play.

Main.TextJPN: 急に振られても、なかなか思いつかない。
Main.TextENG: I couldn't just come up with something on the spot.

Main.TextJPN: 考えあぐねていると、再び魅音がポンを手を打った。
Main.TextENG: While we were all thinking, Mion hit her palm with her fist, just like she did earlier.

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃあさみんな。@k@vS09/03/170300190.牌の宝探しが嫌ならさ。@k@vS09/03/170300191.もうちょっとでっかく宝探しをしようじゃない？@k@vS09/03/170300192.　宝探しと言えば、レナのお家芸！」
Main.TextENG: ``I got an idea.@k@vS09/03/170300190. If you don't want to hunt for tiles,@k@vS09/03/170300191. let's do a real treasure hunt!@k@vS09/03/170300192. What name comes to your mind when I say treasure hunting? Rena, right?``

Main.TextJPN: 「ってことは、ダム現場のゴミ山かぁ！」
Main.TextENG: ``You mean... are we going to the garbage dump at the dam construction site?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あそこって、あんまり行ったことないんですけど、結構広いですわよねぇ？」
Main.TextENG: ``I don't really go there often, but the place is large.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……あそこは、バラバラ殺人の幽霊が出るから近寄らない方がいいらしいのですよ？」
Main.TextENG: ``......I've heard that the place is haunted by the ghost of the man who was murdered there. His body was cut into pieces. We shouldn't go near.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あっはっは！@k@vS09/03/170300194.　幽霊上等じゃないのー！@k@vS09/03/170300195.　そのくらいの演出付かないと宝の山としてはインパクト弱いよねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``Ah ha ha!@k@vS09/03/170300194. A ghost? I like it!@k@vS09/03/170300195. That's even better!``

Main.TextJPN: 「へーー、そんな噂あるのかよ。@k@vS09/01/170100304.……確か、主犯が未だ逃走中。@k@vS09/01/170100305.そいつの隠した腕一本が未だ見付からないとか言うんだろ？」
Main.TextENG: ``I didn't know there was a rumor like that.@k@vS09/01/170100304. ...I do know that someone was murdered there and that the main suspect is still on the loose.@k@vS09/01/170100305. He hid the arm of the victim, and it hasn't been found yet, right?``

Main.TextJPN: 「……その腕を探して、監督さんが、幽霊になって彷徨っているという噂があるのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......There's a rumor that the construction site manager, the victim of the dismemberment murder case, became a ghost and that he's wandering around the place to find his missing arm.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あらあら梨花ぁ！@k@vS09/04/170400057.　幽霊が嫌いなんですのー？！@k@vS09/04/170400058.　いいお歳にもなって恥ずかしいですわねぇ？！」
Main.TextENG: ``Rika?@k@vS09/04/170400057. You don't like ghosts?@k@vS09/04/170400058. Don't tell me you're still scared of ghosts!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……ボクは巫女ですから、見たくなくても見えてしまうのですよ…」
Main.TextENG: ``...I'm a shrine maiden. I can see them even if I don't want to...``

Main.TextJPN: 「うわ……、何だよそれ、霊感ってやつか…？！@k@vS09/01/170100307.　確かに…見える人には当り前のように幽霊が見えるって話、聞いたことあるなぁ」
Main.TextENG: ``Wow... you can see ghosts...?!@k@vS09/01/170100307. If I remember right... I've heard those who can see spirits see them as naturally as they do us.``

Main.TextJPN: 「馬鹿馬鹿しいですわねぇ！@k@vS09/04/170400060.　梨花と一緒にずっと住んでますけど、そんなの一度も見たことありませんでしてよー！」
Main.TextENG: ``That's utterly ridiculous!@k@vS09/04/170400060. I've been living with Rika for a long time, but I've never seen anything like that!``

Main.TextJPN: 「…………沙都子に見えてないだけなのですよ？@k@vS09/05/170500044.　………沙都子がお布団で寝てる時はいつも、…………」
Main.TextENG: ``......That's just because you can't see them. But I can.@k@vS09/05/170500044. ......For example, when you're asleep in your bed, I always see...
Nipah~☆``

Main.TextJPN: 「り、梨花ぁ！@k@vS09/04/170400062.　そこで笑ってはぐらかさないでくださいませ！！@k@vS09/04/170400063.　私が寝てる時は何なんですのー！！！」
Main.TextENG: ``R-Rika!@k@vS09/04/170400062. Why did you smile like that!!@k@vS09/04/170400063. What were you about to say? What do you see when I'm sleeping?!!!``

Main.TextJPN: …沙都子め、可哀想に。
Main.TextENG: ...Satoko, I feel sorry for you.

Main.TextJPN: 今は明るいから強がってるけど、きっと今夜、あとからジワジワ効いて来るに違いない。
Main.TextENG: You can pretend you're not scared of ghosts during the day, but I'm pretty sure you get scared when it gets dark.

Main.TextJPN: ……今日の深夜にでも、一発、無言電話でも掛けてやるかなぁ、いっひっひ！
Main.TextENG: ...I'm gonna have to make a silent phone call tonight just to scare the hell out of her. Hee hee hee!

Main.TextJPN: 「まぁ、私も含めて何だけど、ダム戦争の後に、好き好んであそこに出入りする人はいないんじゃないかねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``Including myself, I don't think anybody really likes going there.

Main.TextJPN: 「レナくらいだよ、楽しそうにあそこで遊んでるのは」
Main.TextENG: Rena is the only one who does.``

Main.TextJPN: 「レナのかぁいいモードの前に幽霊が出た日にゃ、彼岸の向こうからでもお持ち帰りされかねんな」
Main.TextENG: ``If Rena finds a ghost when she's in her Kyute Mode, she might take it home with her.``

Main.TextJPN: 「確かにありそうですわねぇ！」
Main.TextENG: ``That's so true!

Main.TextJPN: 「はぅ～、お持ち帰りぃいぃい～！！　って」
Main.TextENG: She'd say, 'hauu, I'm taking you home with me!!'``

Main.TextJPN: わっはっはっはっは。
Main.TextENG: Wa ha ha ha ha.

Main.TextJPN: あまりに簡単にその様子が想像できたので、みんなで笑った。
Main.TextENG: It was so easy to imagine that all of us laughed.

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃあ決まり！@k@vS09/03/170300199.　今日はゴミ山探検にしよう！」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, let's do it!@k@vS09/03/170300199. Let's go treasure hunting!

Main.TextJPN: 「幽霊を見つけられたら優勝！@k@vS09/03/170300202.　その次は、えぇっと、じゃあレナが気に入りそうな何かだね！@k@vS09/03/170300203.　レナに見せてシロクロを付けてもらうってことでどうよ！」
Main.TextENG: If you find a ghost, you win!@k@vS09/03/170300202. And you also get a point if you find... umm, anything that Rena would like!@k@vS09/03/170300203. We can show what we found to Rena later, and we'll let her decide who's the winner!``

Main.TextJPN: 「をーっほっほ！！@k@vS09/04/170400067.　私は優勝で圭一さんはビリで、ダブル罰ゲームが楽しみですわねー！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Ohh ho ho!!@k@vS09/04/170400067. I can't wait to win the game and make Keiichi-san take double the punishment!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「おいおい沙都子いいのかよ、優勝ってことは幽霊～～、うぇへへへへへ～～～！」
Main.TextENG: ``Hey, Satoko. Are you sure you want to win? That means you're going to see a ghost... Wooooo!``

Main.TextJPN: 「ちょ、ちょっとやめてくださいませ！@k@vS09/04/170400069.　暑苦しいですわぁ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``S-Stop it!@k@vS09/04/170400069. You're getting on my nerves!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……ボクもオバケが怖いので行きたくないのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......I don't want to go there. I'm scared of ghosts, too.``
``What do you mean, 'you're scared of ghosts, too'?@k@vS09/04/170400071. Who else are you referring to?!!

Main.TextJPN: 「私は全然怖くなんかありませんわよー！！@k@vS09/04/170400073.　えぇい、圭一さん、お離しあそばせー！！」
Main.TextENG: I'm not scared at all!!@k@vS09/04/170400073. Hey, Keiichi-san! Stop doing that!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「では行くよ諸君！@k@vS09/03/170300205.　出撃準備ぃいぃ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Let's go, everybody!@k@vS09/03/170300205. Let's find the ghost!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「「おおおーーー！！！」」
……そして終わる。@k全て終わる。
Main.TextENG: ...And it'll be over with.@k@rEverything will be over and done with.
Yes, it will be over when@rthe @w800.hi@w800.gu@w800.ra@w800.shi@w800. cry@|@y.
